text: In which case is a pandemic declared?

responses.text: when the number of contaminated people all over the world reaches a certain number
when the number of deaths all over the world reaches a certain number
there is no official category for a pandemic
responses.answer: Right! In February 2020, a WHO spokesperson clarified that 'there is no official category for a pandemic'.

text: COVID-19 is currently the only pandemic in the world.

responses.answer: Right! Currently, AIDS is also a pandemic, with infection rates as high as 25% in southern and eastern Africa.

text: Over the last 200 years, how many large cholera outbreaks have occurred?

responses.answer: Right! The first cholera pandemic began in India in 1817. Since then, there have been 7 cholera pandemics in general.

text: According to the guidelines of the World Health Organisations introduced several years ago, new disease names should not include geographic locations, the names of people, occupations, animals, or food.

responses.answer: Right! So Donald Trump’s usage of the name “Chinese virus” for COVID-19 wouldn’t be approved by the WHO.

text: The outbreak of what disease led to the downfall of the Aztec empire?

responses.answer: Right! It weakened the population so they were unable to resist Spanish colonizers.

text: The Black Death, which killed at least one third of Europe's population in the 14th century was the first plague pandemic.

responses.answer: Right! The first was the Plague of Justinian, which ravaged the Byzantine Empire and surrounding areas in 541 and 542. The Black Death was the second.

text: In 2016, the experts estimated that in the 21st century pandemic disease events would cost the global economy...

responses.answer: Right! That’s the number given by the Commission on a Global Health Risk Framework for the Future.

text: What is the only human infectious disease to have been completely eradicated?

responses.answer: Right! So far, smallpox is the only human infectious disease to have been completely eradicated.

text: What was MERS-coronavirus also known as?

responses.answer: Right! MERS stands for Middle East respiratory syndrome. Camels are believed to be involved in its spread to humans but it is not proved.
